bio.title: Biography
bio.intro: Andrea Bencini (Florence, April 20, 1990) is a data scientist and artist with a background in statistics and a research thesis focused on graph selection in high-dimensional spaces.
bio.origins.title: Origins and education
bio.origins.text: His path weaves together the analysis of complex systems, artificial intelligence, and reflections on the structures of space and time.
bio.research.title: Research and work as a data scientist
bio.research.text1: Throughout his career, he has worked as a data scientist across diverse fields, from transportation engineering to finance and healthcare, investigating hidden relationships between variables and complex systems and translating them into mathematical and visual models.
bio.research.text2: This cross-disciplinary experience now informs his artistic practice, where data becomes form.
bio.quantum.title: Geometries and Loop Quantum Gravity
bio.quantum.text: In his recent work, he explores emerging geometries inspired by Loop Quantum Gravity.
bio.poetics.title: Poetics
bio.poetics.text1: His poetics arise from a suspended space, where forms exist only as vibrations of possibility.
bio.poetics.text2: From this uncertain territory, artworks surface, allowing code to reveal a single form among many. It is the movement of creation itself, where each idea exists as potential until something calls it into presence.
bio.poetics.text3: Thus, the image becomes the place where the possible concentrates, gathers courage, and finally appears.
